accessLevel.value.description: This field has a default value of public. The values used to populate this field are _public, _private or _showAsBusy.
accessLevel.value.name: accessLevel.value

allDayEvent.description: This field requires a true or false value and is settable only.
allDayEvent.name: allDayEvent

customForm.externalId.description: References an existing custom form for this record type. To ensure that field relationships defined within a desired custom form are maintained, you must provide the customForm value. Also, if defaults are off, then customForm is required, if defaults are on then the default form is used. Internal ID values for existing forms can be found at Setup > Customization > Entry Forms. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.
customForm.externalId.name: customForm.externalId

customForm.internalId.description: References an existing custom form for this record type. To ensure that field relationships defined within a desired custom form are maintained, you must provide the customForm value. Also, if defaults are off, then customForm is required, if defaults are on then the default form is used. Internal ID values for existing forms can be found at Setup > Customization > Entry Forms. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.
customForm.internalId.name: customForm.internalId

customForm.name.description: References an existing custom form for this record type. To ensure that field relationships defined within a desired custom form are maintained, you must provide the customForm value. Also, if defaults are off, then customForm is required, if defaults are on then the default form is used. Internal ID values for existing forms can be found at Setup > Customization > Entry Forms. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.
customForm.name.name: customForm.name

endByDate.description: This field defines the end date for recurring events. Do not set this field for one-time (non-recurring) events.
endByDate.name: endByDate

location.description: Sets the location for the event. If a value is supplied
location.name: location

message.description: Enter any message or notes for this event.This message appears under the event title in the e-mail sent to the people invited to this event.
message.name: message

noEndDate.description: This field allows a true or false value only.
noEndDate.name: noEndDate

organizer.externalId.description: This field has a default value of the current user. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.
organizer.externalId.name: organizer.externalId

organizer.internalId.description: This field has a default value of the current user. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.
organizer.internalId.name: organizer.internalId

organizer.name.description: This field has a default value of the current user. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.
organizer.name.name: organizer.name

recurrence.description: This field is automatically filled in with the information entered when the event was created.The event organizer can change when this event recurs by clicking Edit. Select a new option in the Repeat Every field on the Recurrence tab, and click Submit.
recurrence.name: recurrence

reminderMinutes.value.description: This field has a default value of 15m. The values used to populate this field are _none, _0minutes, _5minutes, _10minutes, _15minutes, _30minutes, _1hour, _2hours, _3hours, _4hours, _5hours, _8hours, _1day, _2days, _3days, or _1week.
reminderMinutes.value.name: reminderMinutes.value

reminderType.value.description: Select Email to receive an e-mail reminder at the address you log in with.Select Popup Window to receive a popup reminder.Set the amount of time before the event your reminder should trigger in the Reminder field. If you select None, you will not receive a reminder.
reminderType.value.name: reminderType.value

sendEmail.description: This field has a default value of false. If set to True, each attendee listed in the attendeeList type is notified of the event via email.
sendEmail.name: sendEmail

seriesStartDate.description: This field is not available for add operations.
seriesStartDate.name: seriesStartDate

startDate.description: The startDate represents the day component and hour/min component of the eventï¿½s start time. Important: For both non-recurring and recurring events, you cannot set multi-day events using the startDate and endDate fields. The interval indicated by startDate/endDate must not cross midnight in the user's indicated time zone. For example, users cannot schedule an event that starts (in their own time zone) on 8/24/07 and ends on 8/25/07. The startDate and endDate must be the same date. Two separate events must be scheduled for events that extend beyond one calendar day.
startDate.name: startDate

status.value.description: This field has a default value of confirmed. The values used to populate this field are _cancelled, _completed, _confirmed or _tentative.
status.value.name: status.value

supportCase.name.name: supportCase.name

timedEvent.description: Check this box if this event requires reserved time on your calendar, such as an hour meeting or another time period you want others to see as not available.Clear this box for items you want to include on your calendar but do not have a set time, such as birthdays and anniversaries.
timedEvent.name: timedEvent

title.description: This sets the subject line of the e-mail sent to those invited to the event, the title displayed if this event is marked public and the title displayed on the calendar of those invited to this event.
title.name: title

transaction.externalId.description: This is a reference to an opportunity record that already exists in your NetSuite account.In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.
transaction.externalId.name: transaction.externalId

transaction.name.name: transaction.name

type.value.description: This is a reference to an opportunity record that already exists in your NetSuite account.In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.
